title: Phase 1: High-Priority Command & Parser Improvements
body:
## Phase 1: High-Priority Command & Parser Improvements

**Priority**: HIGH  
**Effort**: 24-36 hours  
**Timeline**: 2-3 weeks

### Overview

Address critical user-facing improvements including command formatting, PennMUSH compatibility, evaluation fixes, and parser optimizations.

### Items (12 total)

#### 1. Command Formatting & PennMUSH Compatibility (6 items, 10-15h)

- [ ] Room/obj format support for PennMUSH compatibility (4-6h)
- [ ] Decompose formatting improvements (2-3h)
- [ ] Carry format implementation (2-3h)
- [ ] Proper command output formatting (2-3h)

**Files**: GeneralCommands.cs, CommunicationFunctions.cs

#### 2. Evaluation & Context Issues (3 items, 6-10h)

- [ ] VERB evaluation fixes (2-3h)
- [ ] Context switching in parser (2-3h)
- [ ] Re-parsing optimization (2-4h)

**Files**: MoreCommands.cs, SingleTokenCommands.cs

#### 3. Money Transfer System (1 item, 2-3h)

- [ ] Money transfer implementation (2-3h)

**File**: MoreCommands.cs

#### 4. Parser Optimizations (1 item, 2-3h)

- [ ] ansi() replacement ordering fix (2-3h)

**File**: StringFunctions.cs

#### 5. Service Logic Reviews (1 item, 2-4h)

- [ ] Logic review for correctness (2-4h)

**File**: LocateService.cs

### Testing Requirements

- Unit tests for all command formatting changes
- Integration tests for VERB evaluation
- Parser tests for ansi() ordering
- Service logic validation tests

### Success Criteria

- [ ] All command formatting matches PennMUSH behavior
- [ ] VERB evaluation works correctly in all contexts
- [ ] Parser handles ansi() replacement properly
- [ ] Money transfer system functional
- [ ] All tests passing

### Dependencies

None - can be implemented immediately

### Related Issues

None

title: Phase 2: Database Migration & Service Completeness
body:
## Phase 2: Database Migration & Service Completeness

**Priority**: MEDIUM  
**Effort**: 60-90 hours  
**Timeline**: 3-4 weeks

### Overview

Complete database migration tools and service implementations for full feature completeness.

### Items (20 total)

#### 1. Database Migration Tools (7 items, 8-12h)

- [ ] God player name/password handling (2-3h)
- [ ] Room #0 name updates (1-2h)
- [ ] Parent relationship conversion (2-3h)
- [ ] Zone relationship conversion (2-3h)
- [ ] Escape sequence proper conversion (1-2h)

**File**: PennMUSHDatabaseConverter.cs

#### 2. Service Implementations (13 items, 18-25h)

**Quota System**:
- [ ] Quota checking integration (2-3h)
- [ ] Quota deduction when available (2-3h)

**PID Tracking**:
- [ ] PID information retrieval (3-5h)
- [ ] Process tracking completion (2-3h)

**Database Features**:
- [ ] Database iteration support (3-5h)
- [ ] Database-wide counting (2-3h)

**Communication**:
- [ ] Websocket/OOB communication (4-6h)

**Validation**:
- [ ] Length checks for attributes (2-3h)
- [ ] Enum globbing support (2-3h)
- [ ] Multiple database type support (2-3h)

**Files**: MoveService.cs, InformationFunctions.cs, ValidateService.cs, SqlService.cs, various

### Testing Requirements

- Migration tests for all conversion scenarios
- Service integration tests
- Quota system tests
- PID tracking tests
- Database iteration tests

### Success Criteria

- [ ] PennMUSH database fully convertible
- [ ] All services functional
- [ ] Quota system operational
- [ ] PID tracking complete
- [ ] Database features working
- [ ] All tests passing

### Dependencies

- Phase 1 completion recommended but not required

### Related Issues

None

title: Phase 3: Function Enhancements & Polish
body:
## Phase 3: Function Enhancements & Polish

**Priority**: MEDIUM  
**Effort**: 48-72 hours  
**Timeline**: 3-4 weeks

### Overview

Enhance function implementations for improved functionality and PennMUSH compatibility.

### Items (20 total)

#### 1. Attribute Functions (2 items, 4-6h)

- [ ] Target attribute implementation (2-3h)
- [ ] Attribute mediator & service integration (2-3h)

**File**: AttributeFunctions.cs

#### 2. Utility Functions (6 items, 8-12h)

- [ ] Server integration requirements (6-9h)
- [ ] Text file system integration (stext) (2-3h)

**File**: UtilityFunctions.cs

#### 3. Dbref Functions (4 items, 6-10h)

- [ ] Regex matching for search (2-3h)
- [ ] Next dbref tracking (2-3h)
- [ ] obj/attr evaluation for bad results (2-3h)
- [ ] Exit editing improvements (1-2h)

**File**: DbrefFunctions.cs

#### 4. String Functions (2 items, 3-5h)

- [ ] Attribute function character application (2-3h)
- [ ] Better markup handling (1-2h)

**File**: StringFunctions.cs

#### 5. HTML/JSON Functions (3 items, 4-6h)

- [ ] Websocket JSON communication (2-3h)
- [ ] Out-of-band HTML communication (2-3h)

**Files**: HTMLFunctions.cs, JSONFunctions.cs

#### 6. Communication Functions (2 items, 4-6h)

- [ ] Room/obj format support (4-6h)

**File**: CommunicationFunctions.cs

### Testing Requirements

- Function unit tests for all enhancements
- Integration tests for server features
- PennMUSH compatibility tests

### Success Criteria

- [ ] All function enhancements working
- [ ] Server integration functional
- [ ] PennMUSH compatibility improved
- [ ] All tests passing

### Dependencies

- Some items require server infrastructure
- Can be implemented incrementally

### Related Issues

None

title: Phase 4: Command Enhancements & Optimizations
body:
## Phase 4: Command Enhancements & Optimizations

**Priority**: LOW-MEDIUM  
**Effort**: 40-60 hours  
**Timeline**: 2-3 weeks

### Overview

Enhance command implementations with additional features, optimizations, and edge case handling.

### Items (20 total)

#### 1. General Commands Enhancements (15 items, 25-40h)

**Parsing & Evaluation**:
- [ ] Full path parsing implementation (4-6h)
- [ ] Evaluation optimization (don't re-parse) (3-5h)
- [ ] List splitting improvements (3-4h)
- [ ] Better evaluation string handling (2-3h)

**Edge Cases & Validation**:
- [ ] Edge case handling (various) (6-10h)
- [ ] Better error messages (2-3h)
- [ ] Input validation improvements (2-3h)

**Other Improvements**:
- [ ] Various minor enhancements (5-8h)

**File**: GeneralCommands.cs

#### 2. Building Commands (1 item, 2-3h)

- [ ] Exit linking improvements (2-3h)

**File**: BuildingCommands.cs

#### 3. Socket Commands (1 item, 1-2h)

- [ ] Disconnect banner display (1-2h)

**File**: SocketCommands.cs

#### 4. Mail Commands (2 items, 2-3h)

- [ ] AMAIL trigger implementation (1-2h)
- [ ] Mail ID display improvements (1h)

**Files**: Mail command files

### Testing Requirements

- Command tests for all enhancements
- Edge case tests
- Validation tests
- Integration tests

### Success Criteria

- [ ] All command enhancements working
- [ ] Edge cases handled properly
- [ ] Optimizations effective
- [ ] All tests passing

### Dependencies

- Can be implemented independently

### Related Issues

None

title: Phase 5: Handler Implementations & Infrastructure
body:
## Phase 5: Handler Implementations & Infrastructure

**Priority**: LOW  
**Effort**: 16-24 hours  
**Timeline**: 1-2 weeks

### Overview

Complete handler implementations and infrastructure components.

### Items (8 total)

#### 1. Telnet Handlers (3 items, 6-9h)

- [ ] MSSP handler implementation (2-3h)
- [ ] MSDP handler implementation (2-3h)
- [ ] Output handler implementation (2-3h)

**Files**: TelnetMSSPHandler.cs, TelnetMSDPHandler.cs, TelnetOutputHandler.cs

#### 2. Database Handlers (1 item, 2-3h)

- [ ] Object warnings persistence (2-3h)

**File**: SetObjectWarningsCommandHandler.cs

#### 3. Database Features (4 items, 8-12h)

- [ ] Multiple database type support (2-3h)
- [ ] Attribute pattern return value handling (2-3h)
- [ ] Pattern/regex pattern splitting (2-3h)
- [ ] Attribute pattern mode improvements (2-3h)

**Files**: ISharpDatabase.cs, SqlService.cs, HelperFunctions.cs

### Testing Requirements

- Handler unit tests
- Integration tests with telnet
- Database feature tests

### Success Criteria

- [ ] All handlers implemented
- [ ] Telnet features working
- [ ] Database features functional
- [ ] All tests passing

### Dependencies

- Can be implemented independently

### Related Issues

None

title: Complete 7 Remaining Administrative Commands
body:
## Complete 7 Remaining Administrative Commands

**Priority**: LOW  
**Effort**: 15-30 hours  
**Timeline**: 1-2 weeks

### Overview

Implement the 7 remaining administrative commands. These are optional enhancements that do not block production deployment.

### Commands (7 total)

1. **@ALLHALT** (2-4h)
   - Emergency halt all queued commands
   - Requires queue system integration

2. **@CHOWNALL** (2-4h)
   - Change ownership of all objects
   - Requires database iteration

3. **@POLL** (3-5h)
   - Polling/survey system
   - Requires persistence mechanism

4. **@PURGE** (2-4h)
   - Purge inactive objects
   - Requires activity tracking

5. **@READCACHE** (2-3h)
   - Display cache statistics
   - Requires cache system

6. **@SHUTDOWN** (2-4h)
   - Server shutdown
   - Requires graceful shutdown handling

7. **@SUGGEST** (2-4h)
   - Suggestion system
   - Requires persistence mechanism

**File**: WizardCommands.cs

### Testing Requirements

- Unit tests for each command
- Integration tests with queue system
- Database iteration tests
- Permission validation tests
- Actual value tests with unique strings

### Success Criteria

- [ ] All 7 commands implemented
- [ ] All commands tested
- [ ] Permission checks working
- [ ] Edge cases handled
- [ ] 100% command completion achieved

### Dependencies

- Queue system for @ALLHALT
- Database iteration for @CHOWNALL, @PURGE
- Cache system for @READCACHE
- Shutdown infrastructure for @SHUTDOWN
- Persistence for @POLL, @SUGGEST

### Related Issues

None

title: Code Quality & Documentation Improvements
body:
## Code Quality & Documentation Improvements

**Priority**: LOW  
**Effort**: 40-60 hours  
**Timeline**: 2-3 weeks

### Overview

Improve code quality, add documentation, and enhance developer experience across the codebase.

### Categories

#### 1. Code Quality (20-30h)

**Refactoring**:
- [ ] Reduce code duplication
- [ ] Improve naming consistency
- [ ] Extract common patterns
- [ ] Simplify complex methods

**Error Handling**:
- [ ] Improve error messages
- [ ] Add validation where missing
- [ ] Handle edge cases

**Performance**:
- [ ] Identify optimization opportunities
- [ ] Reduce allocations where possible
- [ ] Cache frequently-used values

#### 2. Documentation (10-15h)

**Code Comments**:
- [ ] Add XML documentation
- [ ] Explain complex algorithms
- [ ] Document assumptions
- [ ] Add usage examples

**Guides**:
- [ ] Update developer guides
- [ ] Add architecture documentation
- [ ] Document patterns and conventions

#### 3. Testing (10-15h)

**Test Coverage**:
- [ ] Add missing unit tests
- [ ] Improve integration tests
- [ ] Add edge case tests
- [ ] Ensure all paths tested

**Test Quality**:
- [ ] Use unique test strings
- [ ] Add actual vs expected validation
- [ ] Improve test readability

### Success Criteria

- [ ] Code duplication reduced
- [ ] Error messages improved
- [ ] Documentation complete
- [ ] Test coverage increased
- [ ] All quality metrics improved

### Dependencies

None - can be done incrementally

### Related Issues

None

title: Test Suite Completion & Quality
body:
## Test Suite Completion & Quality

**Priority**: LOW  
**Effort**: 10-15 hours  
**Timeline**: 1-2 weeks

### Overview

Complete test suite with missing tests, fix skipped tests, and improve test quality.

### Items (5 total)

#### 1. Missing Tests (5-8h)

- [ ] Add tests for uncovered code paths
- [ ] Add integration tests for new features
- [ ] Add edge case tests
- [ ] Add error condition tests

#### 2. Test Infrastructure (3-5h)

- [ ] Improve test helpers
- [ ] Add test utilities
- [ ] Enhance test setup/teardown
- [ ] Improve test isolation

#### 3. Test Quality (2-3h)

- [ ] Use unique test strings throughout
- [ ] Ensure actual vs expected comparisons
- [ ] Improve test readability
- [ ] Add descriptive test names

### Testing Requirements

- All tests must pass
- Use unique strings for comparison
- Validate actual vs expected values
- Test all edge cases

### Success Criteria

- [ ] No skipped tests
- [ ] Test coverage >90%
- [ ] All tests passing
- [ ] Test quality high

### Dependencies

None

### Related Issues

None

title: PennMUSH Compatibility Enhancements
body:
## PennMUSH Compatibility Enhancements

**Priority**: MEDIUM  
**Effort**: 30-50 hours  
**Timeline**: 2-3 weeks

### Overview

Enhance PennMUSH compatibility across commands, functions, and behaviors.

### Areas

#### 1. Command Format Compatibility (15-25h)

- [ ] Room/obj format support across all commands
- [ ] Output formatting matches PennMUSH
- [ ] Error messages match PennMUSH
- [ ] Permission checking matches PennMUSH
- [ ] Edge cases match PennMUSH behavior

#### 2. Function Compatibility (10-15h)

- [ ] Function output formats match
- [ ] Error handling matches
- [ ] Edge cases match
- [ ] Evaluation order matches

#### 3. Parser Compatibility (5-10h)

- [ ] Evaluation behavior matches
- [ ] Substitution order matches
- [ ] Context handling matches
- [ ] Special cases match

### Testing Requirements

- Comparison tests with PennMUSH
- Behavior validation tests
- Output format tests
- Edge case tests

### Success Criteria

- [ ] All command formats match PennMUSH
- [ ] All function outputs match
- [ ] Parser behavior compatible
- [ ] Edge cases handled identically
- [ ] Migration from PennMUSH seamless

### Dependencies

- PennMUSH documentation
- Test PennMUSH instance for comparison

### Related Issues

Phase 1, Phase 3

title: Performance Optimization Pass
body:
## Performance Optimization Pass

**Priority**: MEDIUM  
**Effort**: 20-30 hours  
**Timeline**: 1-2 weeks

### Overview

Optimize performance across the codebase based on profiling and analysis.

### Areas

#### 1. Parser Optimizations (8-12h)

- [ ] Cache parsed results where appropriate
- [ ] Reduce re-parsing
- [ ] Optimize evaluation strings
- [ ] Improve substitution performance

#### 2. Database Optimizations (6-10h)

- [ ] Optimize query patterns
- [ ] Add caching where beneficial
- [ ] Reduce database roundtrips
- [ ] Batch operations where possible

#### 3. Memory Optimizations (4-6h)

- [ ] Reduce allocations
- [ ] Use object pooling where beneficial
- [ ] Optimize string operations
- [ ] Reduce garbage collection pressure

#### 4. Other Optimizations (2-4h)

- [ ] Profile hot paths
- [ ] Optimize critical loops
- [ ] Reduce lock contention
- [ ] Improve startup time

### Testing Requirements

- Performance benchmarks
- Profiling before/after
- Regression tests
- Load tests

### Success Criteria

- [ ] Measurable performance improvement
- [ ] No functionality regressions
- [ ] All tests passing
- [ ] Profiling data shows improvement

### Dependencies

- Profiling tools
- Benchmark infrastructure

### Related Issues

Phase 1 (includes some parser optimizations)
